events.name: DriverUpserted
events.description: Full details (not delta) of driver that is added/deleted/modified

events.name: MonitoringUpdated
events.description: This event contains the average cost of rides over a specified duration

events.name: RideCalled
events.description:
Similar schema to ride update, but does not include driver information


Schema includes


ridecalled_id (GUID)

rider_object

number of passengers (int)

drop off coordinates (lat, lon)

pick up coordinates (lat, lon)

car_class



rider_object

  • rider_id (guid)
  • first_name (string)
  • last_name (string)
  • rating (float)

events.name: RideUpdated
events.description:
This needs to be updated to include Driver object and Rider Object


Driver Object

  • driver_id
  • first_name
  • last_name
  • rating
  • car_class


rider_object

  • rider_id (guid)
  • first_name (string)
  • last_name (string)
  • rating (float)

schemas.name: RideAveragePayload
schemas.description: Event Payload which contains average meter readings, average passenger counts, and the number of rides in a given window duration.
schemas.content:
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema",
  "$id": "http://example.com/example.json",
  "type": "object",
  "title": "The root schema",
  "description": "The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.",
  "default": {},
  "examples": [
    {
      "timestamp": "2020-06-04T20:09:59.99832-04:00",
      "avg_meter_reading": 21.615217,
      "avg_passenger_count": 1.5,
      "window_duration_sec": 300,
      "window_ride_count": 5
    }
  ],
  "required": [
    "timestamp",
    "avg_meter_reading",
    "avg_passenger_count",
    "window_duration_sec",
    "window_ride_count"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": true,
  "properties": {
    "timestamp": {
      "$id": "#/properties/timestamp",
      "type": "string",
      "title": "The timestamp schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": "",
      "examples": [
        "2020-06-04T20:09:59.99832-04:00"
      ]
    },
    "avg_meter_reading": {
      "$id": "#/properties/avg_meter_reading",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The avg_meter_reading schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        21.615217
      ]
    },
    "avg_passenger_count": {
      "$id": "#/properties/avg_passenger_count",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The avg_passenger_count schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        1.5
      ]
    },
    "window_duration_sec": {
      "$id": "#/properties/window_duration_sec",
      "type": "integer",
      "title": "The window_duration_sec schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        300
      ]
    },
    "window_ride_count": {
      "$id": "#/properties/window_ride_count",
      "type": "integer",
      "title": "The window_ride_count schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        5
      ]
    }
  }
}

schemas.name: RideUpdated
TaxiStatusUpdatePayload
schemas.content:
{
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/draft-07/schema",
  "$id": "http://example.com/example.json",
  "type": "object",
  "title": "The root schema",
  "description": "The root schema comprises the entire JSON document.",
  "default": {},
  "examples": [
    {
      "ride_id": "545496 c5 - a334 - 4344 - 9662 - efde68c0b98a",
      "point_idx": 107,
      "latitude": 40.75473,
      "longitude": -73.98385,
      "timestamp": "2020 - 06 - 03 T16: 51: 47.29612 - 04:00",
      "meter_reading": 2.4375222,
      "meter_increment": 0.02278058,
      "ride_status": "enroute",
      "passenger_count": 1
    }
  ],
  "required": [
    "ride_id",
    "point_idx",
    "latitude",
    "longitude",
    "timestamp",
    "meter_reading",
    "meter_increment",
    "ride_status",
    "passenger_count"
  ],
  "additionalProperties": true,
  "properties": {
    "ride_id": {
      "$id": "#/properties/ride_id",
      "type": "string",
      "format": "uuid",
      "title": "The ride_id schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": "",
      "examples": [
        "545496 c5 - a334 - 4344 - 9662 - efde68c0b98a"
      ]
    },
    "point_idx": {
      "$id": "#/properties/point_idx",
      "type": "integer",
      "title": "The point_idx schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        107
      ]
    },
    "latitude": {
      "$id": "#/properties/latitude",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The latitude schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        40.75473
      ]
    },
    "longitude": {
      "$id": "#/properties/longitude",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The longitude schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        -73.98385
      ]
    },
    "timestamp": {
      "$id": "#/properties/timestamp",
      "type": "string",
      "title": "The timestamp schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": "",
      "examples": [
        "2020-06-03T16:51:47.29612-04:00"
      ]
    },
    "meter_reading": {
      "$id": "#/properties/meter_reading",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The meter_reading schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        2.4375222
      ]
    },
    "meter_increment": {
      "$id": "#/properties/meter_increment",
      "type": "number",
      "title": "The meter_increment schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        0.02278058
      ]
    },
    "ride_status": {
      "$id": "#/properties/ride_status",
      "type": "string",
      "title": "The ride_status schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": "",
      "examples": [
        "enroute"
      ]
    },
    "passenger_count": {
      "$id": "#/properties/passenger_count",
      "type": "integer",
      "title": "The passenger_count schema",
      "description": "An explanation about the purpose of this instance.",
      "default": 0,
      "examples": [
        1
      ]
    }
  }
}

applications.name: Driver Database
applications.description:
This contains information about Drivers. In the real world, this is used only by the Driver IoT device, as to adhere to microservice principles. In our demos, the simulators also use this.

It contains the "golden record" about all things driver: Name, Address, Driver Id, Password, etc. NEEDS TO INCLUDE "LAST UPDATE SOURCE" field (e.g. Salesforce

applications.name: Ride Simulator - Constant Push
applications.description:
Existing simulator which constantly pumps out ride data (existing)


This is used for analytics use cases where we need a lot of data, or if people just want to have a stream of data to get up and running

applications.name: Ride Simulator - Single ride, request/reply
applications.description:
Simple script (python?)


Takes incoming ride request, generates series of RideUpdated. For initial version, can be the same route every time, Central Park to Times Square.


This is used for demos where more interaction is required (e.g. IoT, mobile, iPaaS backend, etc.)

applications.name: RideDropoffConsumer
applications.description: This is a Spring Cloud Stream microservice that will consume summary events for further analysis

applications.name: RideDropoffProcessor
applications.description: This is a Spring Cloud Stream microservice that will consume the TaxiStatusUpdates with a ride status of "dropoff", process the events, and output summary events.

applications.name: Rider Database
applications.description:
This contains information about Riders. his is used only by the Driver IoT device, as to adhere to microservice principles.

It contains the "golden record" about all things rider: name, address, rider id, password, etc.
